question: What is the citation preferential attachment kernel?
hypothesis: Citations follow PA with kernel f(k)=k^gamma. Predicted gamma=1.3-1.5 (superlinear) under zero-inflated PA model. Zero-inflated model should beat pure PA (BIC).
method: Build temporal citation DAG from Cites: headers in 609 lessons. For each citation event, record in-degree of target at citation time. Compute pool-normalized attachment rate rate(k) = attachments_at_k / pool_exposure_at_k. Fit log-log regression of rate vs k for k>=1. Compare uniform vs PA model via BIC.
expect: Superlinear PA gamma=1.3-1.5. Zero-inflated model beats uniform (BIC). 200+ lessons with citations.
actual: SUBLINEAR PA gamma=0.61 (R2=0.39). Zero-inflation CONFIRMED (5x rate jump k0->k1+). BIC INCONCLUSIVE (delta=-0.47, uniform marginally better). PA ratio 1.30 confirms weak PA signal.
diff: Predicted superlinear gamma=1.3-1.5, got sublinear gamma=0.61. Direction correct (PA exists), magnitude wrong (2x lower). BIC predicted PA better, got uniform marginally better. Zero-inflation confirmed as predicted. The kernel is noisier than expected at high k (small pool sizes). The initial alpha=1.903 estimate was from degree distribution, NOT from the PA kernel â€” mixing up degree distribution exponent with attachment exponent is a substrate error.
